title: Vincent Recaptures the Euphoric Era of Progressive House in New Single, "Surrounded"
description: The nostalgic track blends soaring melodies and euphoric energy, reminding fans why they fell in love with progressive house.
author: Cameron Sunkel
excerpt: The nostalgic track blends soaring melodies and euphoric energy, reminding fans why they fell in love with progressive house.
siteName: EDM.com - The Latest Electronic Dance Music News, Reviews & Artists

html:
The nostalgic track blends soaring melodies and euphoric energy, reminding fans why they fell in love with progressive house.

c/o Press

The nostalgic track blends soaring melodies and euphoric energy, reminding fans why they fell in love with progressive house.

  • Home
  • MUSIC RELEASES

Vincent is leading us on a journey through time, back to the golden age of progressive house, and "Surrounded" is the track lighting the way.

Out now on Dim Mak, "Surrounded" sees Vincent tapping into the heart of arguably dance music's most euphoric chapter: the 2010s. With a sound that blends modern production with a nostalgic soul, the track is a satisfying throwback.

After a three-year mental health break, Vincent's return signals a resurgence in both his personal journey and his artistic output.

"'Surrounded' is a love letter to my golden era of dance music," Vincent said in a press release shared with EDM.com. "It is an ode to incredible vocals, a melody you can belt out, and over-the-top energy. Dance music that gives you the euphoric feeling that it’s made to do. After much sonic theory crafting and figuring out where my sound would go next, this is the first step forward."

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

Building upon an emotional core, "Surrounded" captures the feeling of wanting to push someone away but finding no reason to. Its shimmering synth leads and angelic vocals float together in a way that feels both weightless and heavy, delivering a sonic catharsis that Vincent's fans know all too well.

In terms of its production, "Surrounded" brings a powerful sense of familiarity. The track aligns itself with the uplifting sound that fans have come to expect from Vincent’s releases, such as "All Night" and the dancefloor stomper "Make a Move." But the new single is more than a nostalgic nod—it infuses the timeless essence of progressive house with a refined, contemporary twist to give listeners the best of both worlds.

Listen to the new single below and find it on streaming platforms here.
